marketNews.title: Rupiah Weakens to Lowest Since Asian Financial Crisis Amid Global Uncertainty
marketNews.content: The exchange rate of the rupiah against the US dollar fell -0.5% to the level of 16,641 on Tuesday (25/3) morning, marking the weakest level since June 1998 during the Asian Financial Crisis. The Director of Monetary Management and Securities Assets at Bank Indonesia, Fitra Jusdiman, told Reuters that the central bank would intervene to maintain the stability of the rupiah exchange rate. Jusdiman attributed the rupiah weakening to global uncertainty, including tariffs planned by US President Donald Trump and the Federal Reserve's potentially more hawkish policy.

marketNews.title: US President Trump Threatens Tariffs on Nations Buying Venezuelan Crude Oil
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump on Monday (24/3) issued an executive order to impose a 25% import tariff on countries buying crude oil from Venezuela. Bloomberg reports that this measure is intended not only to suppress Venezuelan trade, which has been under heavy US sanctions, but also to target China as the largest importer, contributing to 40% of Venezuela's crude oil exports.

marketNews.title: US President Trump Teases Auto Tariffs Announcement and Reciprocal Breaks
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump said on Monday (24/3) that he would announce automobile import tariffs in the coming days, and indicated he would grant reciprocal tariff breaks next week. Bloomberg reported that Trump's comments created further confusion regarding his plans for a comprehensive tariff announcement scheduled for April 2, 2025.

marketNews.title: ESDM Confirms Minerba Royalty Rate Hike Will Follow Public Consultation Proposal
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Tri Winarno, stated on Monday (24/3) that the increase in mineral and coal (minerba) royalty rates will follow the proposal presented during the public consultation on March 8, 2025. Previously, the ESDM Ministry's proposal was discussed in the Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: Everstone Capital Divests Full Stake in Domino's Pizza Indonesia Operator
marketNews.content: DealStreetAsia reported that Everstone Capital has sold its entire ownership stake (51%) in PT Dom Pizza Indonesia, which is the operator of Domino's Pizza Indonesia. This news marks the end of the divestment process of Everstone Capital's ownership in the company, which began in 2020. Meanwhile, based on the 9M24 financial report, Mitra Adiperkasa (MPM) has also divested its entire stake (33.52%) in PT Dom Pizza Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: TSPC Records Solid Net Profit in 4Q24 Driven by Exchange Rate Gains; FY24 Core Profit +48% YoY
tickerNews.content: Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC) recorded a solid net profit in 4Q24 of 365 billion rupiah (+62% YoY, +40% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 1.45 trillion rupiah (+23% YoY), in line with our expectations (100% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). The net profit in 4Q24 was mainly driven by exchange rate gains, reflected in other income of 121 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q23: loss of 81 billion rupiah, 3Q24: loss of 161 billion rupiah). This reversal from exchange rate losses to gains aligns with what we previously wrote in the Stockbit Commentary, caused by the strengthening of the US dollar against the rupiah in 4Q24. For information, TSPC had net assets in foreign currency of ~128 million US dollars as of the end of December 2024. Excluding exchange rate gains/losses and non-recurring income/expenses, core profit in 4Q24 tended to be weak at 244 billion rupiah (-20% YoY, -42% QoQ). Nevertheless, core profit throughout 2024 still grew rapidly to 1.34 trillion rupiah (+48% YoY), in line with our expectations (99% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). The relatively weak core profit in 4Q24 was primarily due to a surge in opex, especially in employee salaries and compensation. Sales expenses in 4Q24 increased to 886 billion rupiah (+10% YoY, +34% QoQ), although advertising and promotion expenses decreased annually to 465 billion rupiah (-12% YoY, +22% QoQ). Meanwhile, general and administrative expenses also increased to 204 billion rupiah (+33% YoY, +25% QoQ), resulting in total opex rising to 1.09 trillion rupiah (+14% YoY, +32% QoQ). We suspect the jump in salary and compensation expenses in 4Q24 is related to bonuses paid for the company's excellent performance throughout 2024. In terms of business, TSPC booked solid sales. Although total revenue in 4Q24 only reached 3.5 trillion rupiah (+4% YoY, +4% QoQ), this result was mainly due to weakness in the 'Distribution' segment (-7% YoY). The company's two most important segments - 'Pharmaceuticals' and 'Consumer and Cosmetics' - performed solidly in 4Q24, growing by +10% YoY and +11% YoY, respectively. With these results, the 'Pharmaceuticals' and 'Consumer and Cosmetics' segments grew by +17% YoY and +11% YoY throughout 2024, respectively, in line with our thesis in Unboxing TSPC. Key Takeaway: Although core profit in 4Q24 tended to be weak, this was primarily due to a surge in opex related to salaries and compensation expenses. If our assumption is correct, the high opex in 4Q24 will not recur and will normalize going forward, especially with expectations of more moderate yet still solid profit growth. Currently, we project TSPC's core profit growth in 2025 will be +15% YoY. We believe TSPC's growth prospects will remain solid, primarily driven by the ongoing downtrading trend amidst poor purchasing power conditions. Additionally, TSPC offers attractive dividend potential. With an expected dividend payout ratio of 55%, the potential final dividend for the 2024 fiscal year reached 152 rupiah per share, indicating a yield of ~6.5% based on the share price of 2,340 rupiah per share at the market close on Tuesday (25/3). In terms of valuation, TSPC is currently trading at 6.8x 2025 P/E, a level considered attractive by us for a company with the offered growth prospects.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: BCAP: Bank Central Asia plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum allocation of 1 trillion rupiah from March 26 to June 24, 2025. The company limits the maximum buyback price to 9,200 rupiah per share. This corporate action does not require a General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS), in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: BMRI Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Payout of IDR 43.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: BMRI: Bank Mandiri shareholders today, Tuesday (25/3), approved the distribution of the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to ~43.5 trillion rupiah or 466 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 78% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 60%). The cum-dividend date and payment date have not yet been announced. Referring to the BMRI share price at the market close on Tuesday (25/3) at 4,740 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 9.8%.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Bank Only Net Profit Reached IDR 1.7 Trillion in February 2025
tickerNews.content: BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia recorded a net profit (bank only) of 1.7 trillion rupiah in February 2025 (+7% YoY, +2.1% MoM). This result brought the bank-only net profit over 2M25 to 3.3 trillion rupiah (+8.3% YoY), relatively in line with the 2025 consolidated growth estimate from the consensus (+8.8% YoY). Net profit growth was mainly supported by a decrease in the bank-only cost of credit (CoC) to 0.77% during 2M25 (vs. 2M24: 1.06%), marking the lowest level since at least 1M22 and better than management's 2025 bank-only guidance of ±1%. On the other hand, NIM decreased to 3.58% during 2M25 (vs. 2M24: 3.64%), marking the lowest level since at least 1M22 and below management's 2025 bank-only guidance of 4-4.2%. Meanwhile, credit growth slowed to +10.2% YoY during 2M25 (vs. 1M25: +10.3% YoY, 12M24: +10.7% YoY), consistent with management's intention to target 2025 consolidated growth in the range of +8-10% YoY, while the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio reached 95.7% (vs. 2M24: 87.8%, 1M25: 96.8%).

tickerNews.title: BSDE 4Q24 Net Profit Soars 839% YoY Driven by SMDM Acquisition Gain; FY24 Net Profit +124% YoY
tickerNews.content: BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded a net profit of 1.6 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+839% YoY, +349% QoQ), mainly driven by a one-off gain from the acquisition of Suryamas Dutamakmur (SMDM) shares. This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 4.36 trillion rupiah (+124% YoY), exceeding expectations (130% of consensus 2024F estimate). Meanwhile, operating profit in 4Q24 reached 887 billion rupiah (+39% YoY, +40% QoQ), making the operating profit for 2024 reach 4.47 trillion rupiah (+54% YoY) and below expectations (92% of consensus 2024F estimate). Revenue in 4Q24 decreased year-on-year (-12% YoY, +37% QoQ), although gross profit margin and operating profit margin widened by +1,840 bps YoY and +870 bps YoY, respectively.

tickerNews.title: SSIA 4Q24 Net Profit Plummets 97% YoY; FY24 Net Profit +33% YoY
tickerNews.content: SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa recorded a 4Q24 net profit of 6 billion rupiah (-97% YoY, -95% QoQ), resulting in a 2024 net profit of 234 billion rupiah (+33% YoY). Although revenue in 4Q24 grew high (+58% YoY, +57% QoQ), the gross profit margin dropped drastically to 24.4% (-12 pp YoY, -12 pp QoQ), likely due to the recognition of industrial estate land sales with lower margins. Furthermore, the 4Q24 net profit was pressured by a surge in other expenses to 148 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q23: 23 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 41 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: PWON 4Q24 Net Profit Down 33% YoY Due to Foreign Exchange Loss; FY24 Operating Profit +9% YoY Exceeds Expectations
tickerNews.content: PWON: Pakuwon Jati recorded a net profit of 412 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-33% YoY, -50% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach ~2.1 trillion rupiah (-1.4% YoY), slightly below expectations (97% of consensus 2024F estimate). The decline in net profit in 4Q24 was pressured by a foreign exchange loss reaching 279 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q23: gain of 33 billion rupiah, 3Q24: gain of 375 billion rupiah). However, operationally, PWON recorded good performance with operating profit reaching 794 billion rupiah (+16% YoY, +21% QoQ), so the operating profit for 2024 reached 2.9 trillion rupiah (+9% YoY) and exceeded expectations (102% of consensus 2024F estimate). Operating profit growth in 4Q24 was supported by revenue growth (+16% YoY, +24% QoQ) and gross profit margin expansion year-on-year (+130 bps YoY, -120 bps QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BRMS 4Q24 Net Profit Rises 155% YoY; FY24 Net Profit +75% YoY
tickerNews.content: BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals recorded a net profit of 8.7 million US dollars in 4Q24 (+31% QoQ, +155% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 24.4 million US dollars (+75% YoY), slightly below our expectations (96.8% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). Net profit growth in 4Q24 was driven by revenue growth (+14% QoQ) and gross profit margin expansion to 50.6% (+420 bps QoQ). Additionally, the decrease in tax expense by -90% QoQ also contributed to higher net profit growth.

tickerNews.title: TPMA 4Q24 Net Profit Grows 20% YoY; FY24 Net Profit Slightly Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: TPMA: Trans Power Marine recorded a net profit of 7.6 million US dollars in 4Q24 (+20% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 25.2 million US dollars (+28% YoY), slightly below our expectations (96.5% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). Although revenue declined -7.1% YoY in 4Q24, direct expenses fell more significantly (-12% YoY), causing the gross profit margin in 4Q24 to rise +360 bps YoY to 37.4%. Furthermore, the net profit growth in 4Q24 was also driven by a decrease in other expenses by -67% YoY, mainly due to the reversal of exchange rate losses to a gain of 1.1 million US dollars (vs. 4Q23: loss of 0.2 million US dollars). Quarterly performance comparison for TPMA cannot yet be made as the company has not provided pro-forma financial statements for 1H23 and 1H24 following the consolidation of PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah.

tickerNews.title: ENRG 4Q24 Net Profit Jumps 36% QoQ; FY24 Net Profit +10.2% YoY Despite Large Restoration Liability Provision
tickerNews.content: ENRG: Energi Mega Persada recorded a net profit of 24 million US dollars in 4Q24 (+36% QoQ, +6.1% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 75 million US dollars (+10.2% YoY). Quarterly net profit growth in 4Q24 was driven by a revenue increase (+26% QoQ), while the cost of revenue decreased by -3.1% QoQ, causing the gross profit margin to rise to 39.4% (vs. 3Q24: 21.5%). However, net profit growth was more moderate compared to operating profit (+228% QoQ) due to a loss in the estimated liabilities account for restoring abandoned areas amounting to 34.5 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: MPMX 4Q24 Net Profit +36% YoY; FY24 Operating Profit +25% YoY Exceeds Expectations
tickerNews.content: MPMX: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika recorded a net profit of 142 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+36% YoY, +25% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach 582 billion rupiah (+11% YoY), slightly below our expectations (97% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). Operating profit in 4Q24 grew year-on-year to 114 billion rupiah (+43% YoY, -24% QoQ), resulting in operating profit for 2024 reaching 578 billion rupiah (+25% YoY) and exceeding our expectations (104% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). Operating profit growth throughout 2024 was driven by revenue increases (+14% YoY) and operating profit margin expansion to 3.7% YoY (vs. 2023: 3.3%) as opex grew more moderately (+5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: MSTI 4Q24 Net Profit -15% YoY Due to High Base Effect; FY24 Net Profit +18% YoY
tickerNews.content: MSTI: Mastersystem Infotama posted a net profit of 218 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-15% YoY, +47% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 530 billion rupiah (+18% YoY), in line with our expectations (100% of Stockbit's 2024F estimate). The year-on-year decrease in net profit in 4Q24 was mainly due to a high-base effect. Meanwhile, operating profit for 2024 grew +11% YoY to 646 billion rupiah, mainly driven by revenue growing +28% YoY to 5.36 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: MIKA 4Q24 Net Profit +19% YoY; FY24 Net Profit +25% YoY, Meeting Consensus Estimate
tickerNews.content: MIKA: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat recorded a net profit of 273 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+19% YoY, +0.4% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 1.15 trillion rupiah (+25% YoY), equivalent to 101% of the consensus 2024F estimate. The increase in net profit during 2024 was driven by revenue growth (+13% YoY) and gross profit margin expansion to 53.7% (+380 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: PGEO FY24 Net Profit Slightly Below Expectations Due to Reversal in Other Income
tickerNews.content: PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy recorded a net profit of 27 million US dollars in 4Q24 (-12% YoY, -30% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 160 million US dollars (-2% YoY), slightly below expectations (97% of consensus 2024F estimate). This decrease was primarily caused by other income turning into a loss of 1.7 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: gain of 1.1 million US dollars, 4Q23: gain of 2 million US dollars). On the operational level, operating profit for 2024 decreased by -5% YoY to 211 million US dollars, mainly due to an increase in financial service costs in the general and administrative expenses line. Electricity production volume during 2024 reached 4,827 GWh (+2% YoY), equivalent to 100.5% of management's 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: CNMA Approves IDR 750 Billion Final Dividend Payout and IDR 300 Billion Buyback Plan
tickerNews.content: The GMS of Nusantara Sejahtera Raya (CNMA) approved the plan to distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to 750 billion rupiah, implying a final dividend of 4 rupiah per share and an indicated final dividend yield of 3.1% based on Tuesday's (25/3) closing price. Previously, CNMA had distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 5 rupiah per share in November 2024. CNMA shareholders also approved a share buyback plan with a maximum fund allocation of 300 billion rupiah and a maximum buyback price of 270 rupiah per share. The share buyback will be executed no later than 12 months from its approval at the GMS.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Directors Jimmy Tandyo and Mery Sofi Purchase Shares
tickerNews.content: Two directors of AKR Corporindo (AKRA), Jimmy Tandyo and Mery Sofi, purchased 1 million and 800,000 shares of AKRA, respectively, at an average price of 1,108 rupiah per share and 1,100 rupiah per share on March 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.1 billion rupiah and 888 million rupiah, respectively. After these transactions, the ownership portion of Jimmy and Mery in AKRA increased by 0.005 and 0.004 percentage points to 0.199% and 0.015%, respectively.

tickerNews.title: MAIN Plans Share Buyback Up to 15% of Shares with IDR 252 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: Malindo Feedmill (MAIN) plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 336 million (15%) shares with a maximum fund allocation of 252 billion rupiah, implying an average price of 750 rupiah per share. This corporate action will run until June 24, 2025, and does not require a GMS in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: ISSP Plans Share Buyback Up to 1.16% of Shares with IDR 25 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia (ISSP) plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 83.3 million (1.16%) shares with a maximum fund allocation of 25 billion rupiah. The maximum buyback price is set at 300 rupiah per share. This corporate action will run until June 24, 2025, and does not require a GMS in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: AMAG Plans Share Buyback Up to 3.8% of Shares with IDR 62.5 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: Asuransi Multi Artha Guna (AMAG) plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 187.5 million (3.8%) shares with a maximum fund allocation of 62.5 billion rupiah, implying an average price of 333 rupiah per share. This corporate action will be carried out within a maximum of 12 months since its approval at the GMS on April 29, 2025.
